name: INPC
title: International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification (INPC)
subtitle: Shimada Classification, Unfavorable histology or Favorable histology
notes:
**Note 1:** This SSDI is effective for diagnosis years 2023+
* For cases diagnosed 2018-2022, leave this SSDI blank

**Note 2:** Physician statement of unfavorable vs favorable histology can be used to code this data item when no other information is available. 

**Note 3:** The International Neuroblastoma Pathology Prognostic Classification (INPC) (unfavorable versus favorable histology) is a biologically relevant classification based on morphologic features of neuroblastic tumors which has prognostic indications. It is based on the following criteria.
* Age
* Neuroblastic maturation
* Schwannian stromal content
* Mitosis-kayorrhexis index (MKI)
* Degree of differentiation (grade)
footnotes: (1) American Society of Clinical Oncology Â© 2009, The International Neuroblastoma Risk Group (INRG) Classification System: AN INRG Task Force Report; published by American Society of Clinical Oncology, 2009
rows: Test ordered, results not in chart

Not applicable: Information not collected for this case
